note.p: Birth: Woodside, near Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, Scotland (13 January 1843)
Death: York House, Kensington, London (19 March 1928)
Education: Grammar School, Aberdeen; University of Aberdeen. MA (1863); MB (1868, Edinburgh), MD (Edinburgh)

Career: Ferguson Scholar of the Scottish Universities; practised in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk; went to London (1870); Lecturer in Physiology, Middlesex Hospital; Professor of Forensic Medicine, King's College; Physician, King's College Hospital; Physician, National Hospital for Paralysed and Epileptic; after his death Â£1,000 was collected by his friends to endow the Royal Society Ferrier Memorial Lecture
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1928 vol 103 pp viii-xvi, plate, signed by C S S
References: David Millett, 'Illustrating a Revolution: An Unrecognized Contribution to the "Golden Era" of Cerebral Localization' in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 283-305, plate
Notes: William Guy has signed under General Knowledge, but with a note: '(personal knowledge)'
